item.content:encoded: Image: Pok√©mon Center Take a load off in a round, plump Lechonk, Gengar, or Jigglypuff Pok√©mon Center has become a leading purveyor of all things round, squishy, and big. First we got the comically large life-sized Spheal. Now the online seller of Pok√©mon merchandise has released another banger: Pok√©mon bean bag chairs. As of Wednesday, fans can pre-order from the Pok√©mon x Yogibo line. Interested buyers have the options to purchase round, plump bean bag versions of Lechonk, Gengar, and Jiggly...

item.content:encoded: Image: Arkane Studios / Bethesda Softworks There‚Äôs no immersive sim like it A brutal year of gaming industry layoffs has led to the unceremonious closure of studios that many believed to be the definition of successful. There‚Äôs a lot of ink worth spilling on each studio, but one closure that stood out to me was Arkane Austin, which Microsoft said on Tuesday would close its doors. (The French side of the business, Arkane Lyon, will continue on.) Arkane Austin was behind one of the best games of...

item.content:encoded: Image: SEGA / Rovio Mario Party, move aside Sega has been playing a little fast and loose with Sonic the Hedgehog lately, using the blue blur for experimental projects like The Murder of Sonic the Hedgehog. At the same time, the movies based on the franchise have been surprisingly good. Here‚Äôs another treat for the Sonic enjoyers out there: Sega just announced Sonic Rumble, a 32-player PvP mobile game created with Finnish studio Rovio.
